favourite.article: Thank you having this lyrics and tune online. I remember this songs today after an incident. It has been over 20 years sinces sang it. I could not get it out of my spirit until I surf for it and bingo you have it as I knew it. Thank you and God bless you.
Brother Nath in Nigeria, posted a line from this song this morning I had not heard or thought of it in years. Enjoying it weeping; Also all the comments, so encouraging and blending.

Born in Napoleon, OH, he taught music and became a preacher in the Methodist Episcopal Church and was active in evangelistic work. He was a singer, song writer, and compiler as well as a publisher of a number of songbooks. ----------- Stanza 2 & 3 in the original say: 2 I now believe Thou dost receive, For Thou hast died that I might live; And now henceforth I’ll trust to Thee, My Savior and my God! ------------ 3 Oh, Thou who died on Calvary, To save my soul and make me free; I’ll consecrate my life to Thee, My Savior and my God!

I and my family cannot be grateful enough to the work of the Holy Spirit through the composer of this inspiring and reviving hymn. Likewise the committed pianist, I love you all. "I pray always... Oh let me ever be faithful to thee, My Savior and my God."
What a wonderful and inspiring lyrics. God bless the composer. Dead or Alive.

This song always makes me to renew my commitment to God. It's one my most admired songs in my early Christian years. I am happy to see it written in the English language because I'm more familiar with my local language. God bless you richly.

After a beautiful time with the Lord this morning, this tune popped into my head. I hadn't thought of it for years! Literally! I was frustrated because I couldn't remember the words and googled and found the words and wept! It speaks the heart of what God and I were discussing this morning! He so obviously brought it to my remembrance! Praise Him! Thank you for making this site available! Praise God from Whom all blessing flow!

His life for mine; now my life for His, namely that His life in me may be known to others. His devotion to me that can only be answered by my devotion to Him...and even then it's not enough...I'm forever in His debt. All, then, is reduced, distilled into worship.
It's a very beautiful melody and the lyrics are very uplifting and encouraging.
